intro: Hoya jiewhoeana, commonly known as the "Jiewhoea Hoya," is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped and have a smooth, glossy texture. Hoya jiewhoeana is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
